intro: Hibbertia hypericoides subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern bush daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with red centres. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Hibbertia hypericoides subsp. septentrionalis is often found in the southern and western regions of Western Australia.
